definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: For this reason the Benedictine Rule became the standard in western Europe.
sentences.chinese: 爲此，本篤會的規則，成爲標準在西歐。

sentences.english: Year on top of the island in 969 years to build a Benedictine monastery.
sentences.chinese: 公元969年在島頂上建造了本篤會隱修院。

sentences.english: She teaches writing at College of DuPage and Benedictine University.
sentences.chinese: 佛提爾目前在杜佩奇學院及本篤會大學教寫作。

sentences.english: A man who went from being the Premier of China to being a Benedictine monk and priest.
sentences.chinese: 他從中國的總理變成了本篤會的修士和神父。
